page.title: 01ALDINGHAM GENERAL OUTLINE
page.content: Some of our class have been going to Aldingham for two weeks and have been looking around. Most of our twelve square kilometres is salt water estuary, in fact ninety-eight percent! Bordering our patch is a old church with a grave- yard and a enormous building, it used to be a huge private mansion, with a large garden that covers some of our square. There is the remains of a railing which was cut down in World War Two for scrap iron on a very old wall that is small in height and long in length. Just behind that is a wood which protects the mansion from the sea. And just behind that is the sea and the beach. There is a planted wood which protects the house from the south wind.
